snippet: Across Beijing, residents braced for another “airpocalypse” — the term that some English speakers in the city use for the most toxic bouts of air pollution.
abstract: Authorities in Beijing issue first-ever red alert after smog rises to toxic levels, requiring school closures, driving restrictions and ban on outdoor fires; residents scramble to adjust to oddly-timed announcement, which some suggest is response to criticism of government's presumed reluctance to raise alarm beyond orange.
lead_paragraph: Across Beijing, residents braced for another “airpocalypse” — the term that some English speakers in the city use for the most toxic bouts of air pollution.

headline.main: Beijing Issues Red Alert Over Air Pollution for the First Time
headline.print_headline: Beijing Issues First Red Alert for Air Pollution as Smog Blankets City
